module.name: corecommands
module.summary: Core policy for shells, and generic programs in /bin, /sbin, /usr/bin, and /usr/sbin.
module.required: Contains the base bin and sbin directory types which need to be searched for the kernel to run init.

interface.name: corecmd_executable_file
interface.summary: Make the specified type usable for files that are exectuables, such as binary programs. This does not include shared libraries.

param.name: type
param.summary: Type to be used for files.

interface.name: corecmd_bin_entry_type
interface.summary: Make general progams in bin an entrypoint for the specified domain.

param.name: domain
param.summary: The domain for which bin_t is an entrypoint.

interface.name: corecmd_shell_entry_type
interface.summary: Make the shell an entrypoint for the specified domain.

param.name: domain
param.summary: The domain for which the shell is an entrypoint.

interface.name: corecmd_search_bin
interface.summary: Search the contents of bin directories. Also allow to read a possible /bin->/usr/bin symlink.

interface.name: corecmd_dontaudit_search_bin
interface.summary: Do not audit attempts to search the contents of bin directories.

interface.name: corecmd_list_bin
interface.summary: List the contents of bin directories.

interface.name: corecmd_dontaudit_write_bin_dirs
interface.summary: Do not audit attempts to write bin directories.

interface.name: corecmd_getattr_bin_files
interface.summary: Get the attributes of files in bin directories.

interface.name: corecmd_dontaudit_getattr_bin_files
interface.summary: Do not audit attempts to get the attributes of files in bin directories.

interface.name: corecmd_check_exec_bin_files
interface.summary: Check if files in bin directories are executable (DAC-wise)

interface.name: corecmd_read_bin_files
interface.summary: Read files in bin directories.

interface.name: corecmd_dontaudit_write_bin_files
interface.summary: Do not audit attempts to write bin files.

interface.name: corecmd_read_bin_symlinks
interface.summary: Read symbolic links in bin directories.

interface.name: corecmd_read_bin_pipes
interface.summary: Read pipes in bin directories.

interface.name: corecmd_read_bin_sockets
interface.summary: Read named sockets in bin directories.

interface.name: corecmd_exec_bin
interface.summary: Execute generic programs in bin directories, in the caller domain.

desc.p: Allow the specified domain to execute generic programs in system bin directories (/bin, /sbin, /usr/bin, /usr/sbin) a without domain transition.

Typically, this interface should be used when the domain executes general system progams within the privileges of the source domain. Some examples of these programs are ls, cp, sed, python, and tar. This does not include shells, such as bash.
Related interface:

interface.name: corecmd_manage_bin_files
interface.summary: Create, read, write, and delete bin files.

interface.name: corecmd_relabel_bin_files
interface.summary: Relabel to and from the bin type.

interface.name: corecmd_mmap_bin_files
interface.summary: Mmap a bin file as executable.

interface.name: corecmd_bin_spec_domtrans
interface.summary: Execute a file in a bin directory in the specified domain but do not do it automatically. This is an explicit transition, requiring the caller to use setexeccon().

desc.p: Execute a file in a bin directory in the specified domain. This allows the specified domain to execute any file on these filesystems in the specified domain. This is not suggested.
No interprocess communication (signals, pipes, etc.) is provided by this interface since the domains are not owned by this module.
This interface was added to handle the userhelper policy.

param.name: target_domain
param.summary: The type of the new process.

interface.name: corecmd_bin_domtrans
interface.summary: Execute a file in a bin directory in the specified domain.

desc.p: Execute a file in a bin directory in the specified domain. This allows the specified domain to execute any file on these filesystems in the specified domain. This is not suggested.
No interprocess communication (signals, pipes, etc.) is provided by this interface since the domains are not owned by this module.
This interface was added to handle the ssh-agent policy.

param.name: target_domain
param.summary: The type of the new process.

interface.name: corecmd_check_exec_shell
interface.summary: Check if a shell is executable (DAC-wise).

interface.name: corecmd_exec_shell
interface.summary: Execute shells in the caller domain.

desc.p: Allow the specified domain to execute shells without a domain transition.
Typically, this interface should be used when the domain executes shells within the privileges of the source domain. Some examples of these programs are bash, tcsh, and zsh.
Related interface:

interface.name: corecmd_shell_spec_domtrans
interface.summary: Execute a shell in the target domain. This is an explicit transition, requiring the caller to use setexeccon().

desc.p: Execute a shell in the target domain. This is an explicit transition, requiring the caller to use setexeccon().
No interprocess communication (signals, pipes, etc.) is provided by this interface since the domains are not owned by this module.

param.name: target_domain
param.summary: The type of the shell process.

interface.name: corecmd_shell_domtrans
interface.summary: Execute a shell in the specified domain.

desc.p: Execute a shell in the specified domain.
No interprocess communication (signals, pipes, etc.) is provided by this interface since the domains are not owned by this module.

param.name: target_domain
param.summary: The type of the shell process.

interface.name: corecmd_exec_chroot
interface.summary: Execute chroot in the caller domain.

interface.name: corecmd_getattr_all_executables
interface.summary: Get the attributes of all executable files.

interface.name: corecmd_read_all_executables
interface.summary: Read all executable files.

interface.name: corecmd_exec_all_executables
interface.summary: Execute all executable files.

interface.name: corecmd_dontaudit_exec_all_executables
interface.summary: Do not audit attempts to execute all executables.

interface.name: corecmd_manage_all_executables
interface.summary: Create, read, write, and all executable files.

interface.name: corecmd_relabel_all_executables
interface.summary: Relabel to and from the bin type.

interface.name: corecmd_mmap_all_executables
interface.summary: Mmap all executables as executable.

module.name: corenetwork
module.summary: Policy controlling access to network objects
module.required: Contains the initial SIDs for network objects.

interface.name: corenet_port
interface.summary: Define type to be a network port type

desc.p: Define type to be a network port type
This is for supporting third party modules and its use is not allowed in upstream reference policy.

param.name: domain
param.summary: Type to be used for network ports.

interface.name: corenet_reserved_port
interface.summary: Define network type to be a reserved port (lt 1024)

desc.p: Define network type to be a reserved port (lt 1024)
This is for supporting third party modules and its use is not allowed in upstream reference policy.

param.name: domain
param.summary: Type to be used for network ports.

interface.name: corenet_rpc_port
interface.summary: Define network type to be a rpc port ( 512 lt PORT lt 1024)

This is for supporting third party modules and its use is not allowed in upstream reference policy.

param.name: domain
param.summary: Type to be used for network ports.

This is for supporting third party modules and its use is not allowed in upstream reference policy.

param.summary: Type to be used for network nodes.

This is for supporting third party modules and its use is not allowed in upstream reference policy.

param.name: domain
param.summary: Type to be used for a network packet.

interface.name: corenet_client_packet

This is for supporting third party modules and its use is not allowed in upstream reference policy.

param.name: domain
param.summary: Type to be used for a network client packet.

interface.name: corenet_server_packet
interface.summary: Define type to be a network server packet type

desc.p: Define type to be a network server packet type
This is for supporting third party modules and its use is not allowed in upstream reference policy.

param.name: domain
param.summary: Type to be used for a network server packet.

interface.name: corenet_spd_type
interface.summary: Make the specified type usable for labeled ipsec.

param.name: domain
param.summary: Type to be used for labeled ipsec.

interface.name: corenet_ib_pkey
interface.summary: Define type to be an infiniband pkey type

desc.p: Define type to be an infiniband pkey type
This is for supporting third party modules and its use is not allowed in upstream reference policy.

param.name: domain
param.summary: Type to be used for infiniband pkeys.

interface.name: corenet_ib_endport
interface.summary: Define type to be an infiniband endport

This is for supporting third party modules and its use is not allowed in upstream reference policy.

param.name: domain
param.summary: Type to be used for infiniband endports.

interface.name: corenet_tcp_sendrecv_generic_if
interface.summary: Send and receive TCP network traffic on generic interfaces.

desc.p: Allow the specified domain to send and receive TCP network traffic on generic network interfaces.
Related interface:
Example client being able to connect to all ports over generic nodes, without labeled networking:

allow myclient_t self:tcp_socket create_stream_socket_perms; corenet_tcp_sendrecv_generic_if(myclient_t) corenet_tcp_sendrecv_generic_node(myclient_t) corenet_tcp_sendrecv_all_ports(myclient_t) corenet_tcp_connect_all_ports(myclient_t) corenet_all_recvfrom_unlabeled(myclient_t)

interface.name: corenet_dontaudit_raw_recvfrom_unlabeled
interface.summary: Do not audit attempts to receive Raw IP packets from an unlabeled connection.

interface.name: corenet_all_recvfrom_unlabeled
interface.summary: Receive packets from an unlabeled connection.

desc.p: Allow the specified domain to receive packets from an unlabeled connection. On machines that do not utilize labeled networking, this will be required on all networking domains. On machines tha do utilize labeled networking, this will be required for any networking domain that is allowed to receive network traffic that does not have a label.

interface.name: corenet_all_recvfrom_netlabel
interface.summary: Receive packets from a NetLabel connection.

desc.p: Allow the specified domain to receive NetLabel network traffic, which utilizes the Commercial IP Security Option (CIPSO) to set the MLS level of the network packets. This is required for all networking domains that receive NetLabel network traffic.

interface.name: corenet_dontaudit_all_recvfrom_unlabeled
interface.summary: Do not audit attempts to receive packets from an unlabeled connection.

interface.name: corenet_dontaudit_sctp_connect_all_reserved_ports
interface.summary: Do not audit attempts to connect SCTP sockets all reserved ports.

interface.name: corenet_dontaudit_all_recvfrom_netlabel
interface.summary: Do not audit attempts to receive packets from a NetLabel connection.

interface.name: corenet_tcp_recvfrom_labeled
interface.summary: Rules for receiving labeled TCP packets.

desc.p: Rules for receiving labeled TCP packets.
Due to the nature of TCP, this is bidirectional.

interface.name: corenet_udp_recvfrom_labeled
interface.summary: Rules for receiving labeled UDP packets.

interface.name: corenet_raw_recvfrom_labeled
interface.summary: Rules for receiving labeled raw IP packets.

interface.name: corenet_all_recvfrom_labeled
interface.summary: Rules for receiving labeled packets via TCP, UDP and raw IP.

desc.p: Rules for receiving labeled packets via TCP, UDP and raw IP.
Due to the nature of TCP, the rules (for TCP networking only) are bidirectional.

interface.name: corenet_setcontext_all_spds
interface.summary: Allow specified type to set the context of a SPD entry for labeled ipsec associations.

module.name: devices
module.summary: Device nodes and interfaces for many basic system devices.

desc.p: This module creates the device node concept and provides the policy for many of the device files. Notable exceptions are the mass storage and terminal devices that are covered by other modules.
This module creates the concept of a device node. That is a char or block device file, usually in /dev. All types that are used to label device nodes should use the dev_node macro.

Additionally, this module controls access to three things:
the device directories containing device nodes
device nodes as a group
individual access to specific device nodes covered by this module.

module.required: Depended on by other required modules.

interface.name: dev_node
interface.summary: Make the specified type usable for device nodes in a filesystem.

desc.p: Make the specified type usable for device nodes in a filesystem. Types used for device nodes that do not use this interface, or an interface that calls this one, will have unexpected behaviors while the system is running.
Example:

interface.name: dev_read_urand
interface.summary: Read from pseudo random number generator devices (e.g., /dev/urandom).

desc.p: Allow the specified domain to read from pseudo random number generator devices (e.g., /dev/urandom). Typically this is used in situations when a cryptographically secure random number is not necessarily needed. One example is the Stack Smashing Protector (SSP, formerly known as ProPolice) support that may be compiled into programs.
Related interface:
Related tunable:

interface.name: dev_dontaudit_read_urand
interface.summary: Do not audit attempts to read from pseudo random devices (e.g., /dev/urandom)

interface.name: dev_write_urand
interface.summary: Write to the pseudo random device (e.g., /dev/urandom). This sets the random number generator seed.

interface.name: dev_create_urand_dev
interface.summary: Create the urandom device (/dev/urandom).

module.name: domain
module.required: Contains the concept of a domain.

interface.name: domain_base_type
interface.summary: Make the specified type usable as a basic domain.

desc.p: Make the specified type usable as a basic domain.

param.name: type
param.summary: Type to be used as a basic domain type.

interface.name: domain_type
interface.summary: Make the specified type usable as a domain.

desc.p: Make the specified type usable as a domain. This, or an interface that calls this interface, must be used on all types that are used as domains.
Related interfaces:
Example:

param.name: type
param.summary: Type to be used as a domain type.

interface.name: domain_entry_file
interface.summary: Make the specified type usable as an entry point for the domain.

param.name: type
param.summary: Type of program used for entering the domain.

interface.name: domain_interactive_fd
interface.summary: Make the file descriptors of the specified domain for interactive use (widely inheritable)

interface.name: domain_dyntrans_type
interface.summary: Allow the specified domain to perform dynamic transitions.

desc.p: Allow the specified domain to perform dynamic transitions.
This violates process tranquility, and it is strongly suggested that this not be used.

interface.name: domain_system_change_exemption
interface.summary: Makes caller and execption to the constraint preventing changing to the system user identity and system role.

interface.name: domain_subj_id_change_exemption
interface.summary: Makes caller an exception to the constraint preventing changing of user identity.

param.name: domain
param.summary: The process type to make an exception to the constraint.

interface.name: domain_role_change_exemption
interface.summary: Makes caller an exception to the constraint preventing changing of role.

param.name: domain
param.summary: The process type to make an exception to the constraint.

interface.name: domain_obj_id_change_exemption
interface.summary: Makes caller an exception to the constraint preventing changing the user identity in object contexts.

param.name: domain
param.summary: The process type to make an exception to the constraint.

interface.name: domain_user_exemption_target
interface.summary: Make the specified domain the target of the user domain exception of the SELinux role and identity change constraints.

desc.p: Make the specified domain the target of the user domain exception of the SELinux role and identity change constraints.
This interface is needed to decouple the user domains from the base module. It should not be used other than on user domains.

interface.name: domain_cron_exemption_source
interface.summary: Make the specified domain the source of the cron domain exception of the SELinux role and identity change constraints.

desc.p: Make the specified domain the source of the cron domain exception of the SELinux role and identity change constraints.
This interface is needed to decouple the cron domains from the base module. It should not be used other than on cron domains.

interface.name: domain_cron_exemption_target
interface.summary: Make the specified domain the target of the cron domain exception of the SELinux role and identity change constraints.

desc.p: Make the specified domain the target of the cron domain exception of the SELinux role and identity change constraints.
This interface is needed to decouple the cron domains from the base module. It should not be used other than on user cron jobs.

interface.name: domain_use_interactive_fds
interface.summary: Inherit and use file descriptors from domains with interactive programs.

desc.p: Allow the specified domain to inherit and use file descriptors from domains with interactive programs. This does not allow access to the objects being referenced by the file descriptors.

interface.name: domain_dontaudit_use_interactive_fds
interface.summary: Do not audit attempts to inherit file descriptors from domains with interactive programs.

interface.name: domain_sigchld_interactive_fds
interface.summary: Send a SIGCHLD signal to domains whose file discriptors are widely inheritable.

interface.summary: Do not audit attempts to search the process state directory (/proc/pid) of all domains.

interface.name: domain_read_all_domains_state
interface.summary: Read the process state (/proc/pid) of all domains.

interface.name: domain_getattr_all_domains
interface.summary: Get the attributes of all domains of all domains.

interface.name: domain_dontaudit_getattr_all_domains
interface.summary: Do not audit attempts to get the attributes of all domains.

interface.name: domain_read_confined_domains_state
interface.summary: Read the process state (/proc/pid) of all confined domains.

interface.name: domain_getattr_confined_domains

interface.name: domain_ptrace_all_domains
interface.summary: Ptrace all domains.

interface.name: domain_dontaudit_ptrace_all_domains
interface.summary: Do not audit attempts to ptrace all domains.

desc.p: Do not audit attempts to ptrace all domains.
Generally this needs to be suppressed because procps tries to access /proc/pid/environ and this now triggers a ptrace check in recent kernels (2.4 and 2.6).

interface.name: domain_dontaudit_ptrace_confined_domains
interface.summary: Do not audit attempts to ptrace confined domains.

desc.p: Do not audit attempts to ptrace confined domains.
Generally this needs to be suppressed because procps tries to access /proc/pid/environ and this now triggers a ptrace check in recent kernels (2.4 and 2.6).

This is commonly used for domains that can use lsof on all domains.

This interface was added for PCMCIA cardmgr and is probably excessive.

This is commonly used for domains that can use lsof on all domains.

interface.name: domain_mmap_low
interface.summary: Ability to mmap a low area of the address space conditionally, as configured by /proc/sys/kernel/mmap_min_addr. Preventing such mappings helps protect against exploiting null deref bugs in the kernel.

interface.name: domain_mmap_low_uncond
interface.summary: Ability to mmap a low area of the address space unconditionally, as configured by /proc/sys/kernel/mmap_min_addr. Preventing such mappings helps protect against exploiting null deref bugs in the kernel.

interface.name: domain_all_recvfrom_all_domains
interface.summary: Allow specified type to receive labeled networking packets from all domains, over all protocols (TCP, UDP, etc)

interface.name: domain_public_key
interface.summary: Allow all domains to search specified type keys.

desc.p: When setting up IMA/EVM key(s) are added to the kernel keyring but the type of the key is the domain adding the key. This interface will allow all domains search the key so IMA/EVM validation can happen.

param.name: type
param.summary: Type of key to be searched.

interface.name: domain_unconfined_signal
interface.summary: Send generic signals to the unconfined domain.

interface.name: domain_unconfined
interface.summary: Unconfined access to domains.

desc.p: Control the ability to mmap a low area of the address space, as configured by /proc/sys/kernel/mmap_min_addr.

module.name: files

desc.p:
This module contains basic filesystem types and interfaces. This includes:
The concept of different file types including basic files, mount points, tmp files, etc.
Access to groups of files and all files.
Types and interfaces for the basic filesystem layout (/, /etc, /tmp, /usr, etc.).

module.required: Contains the concept of a file. Comains the file initial SID.

interface.name: files_type
interface.summary: Make the specified type usable for files in a filesystem.

desc.p: Make the specified type usable for files in a filesystem. Types used for files that do not use this interface, or an interface that calls this one, will have unexpected behaviors while the system is running. If the type is used for device nodes (character or block files), then the dev_node() interface is more appropriate.
Related interfaces:
Example:

param.name: type
param.summary: Type to be used for files.

interface.name: files_auth_file
interface.summary: Mark the specified type as a file that is related to authentication.

interface.name: files_security_file
interface.summary: Make the specified type a file that should not be dontaudited from browsing from user domains.

param.name: file_type
param.summary: Type of the file to be used as a member directory.

interface.name: files_lock_file
interface.summary: Make the specified type usable for lock files.

param.name: type
param.summary: Type to be used for lock files.

interface.name: files_mountpoint
interface.summary: Make the specified type usable for filesystem mount points.

param.name: type
param.summary: Type to be used for mount points.

interface.name: files_security_mountpoint
interface.summary: Make the specified type usable for security file filesystem mount points.

param.name: type
param.summary: Type to be used for mount points.

interface.name: files_pid_file
interface.summary: Make the specified type usable for runtime process ID files. (Deprecated)

desc.p: Make the specified type usable for runtime process ID files, typically found in /var/run. This will also make the type usable for files, making calls to files_type() redundant. Failure to use this interface for a PID file type may result in problems with starting or stopping services.
Related interfaces:
Example usage with a domain that can create and write its PID file with a private PID file type in the /var/run directory:

param.name: type
param.summary: Type to be used for PID files.

interface.name: files_runtime_file
interface.summary: Make the specified type usable for runtime process ID files.

desc.p: Make the specified type usable for runtime process ID files, typically found in /var/run. This will also make the type usable for files, making calls to files_type() redundant. Failure to use this interface for a PID file type may result in problems with starting or stopping services.
Related interfaces:
Example usage with a domain that can create and write its PID file with a private PID file type in the /var/run directory:

param.name: type
param.summary: Type to be used for PID files.

interface.name: files_config_file
interface.summary: Make the specified type a configuration file.

desc.p: Make the specified type usable for configuration files. This will also make the type usable for files, making calls to files_type() redundant. Failure to use this interface for a temporary file may result in problems with configuration management tools.
Example usage with a domain that can read its configuration file /etc:

param.name: file_type
param.summary: Type to be used as a configuration file.

interface.name: files_poly
interface.summary: Make the specified type a polyinstantiated directory.

param.name: file_type
param.summary: Type of the file to be used as a polyinstantiated directory.

interface.name: files_poly_parent
interface.summary: Make the specified type a parent of a polyinstantiated directory.

param.name: file_type
param.summary: Type of the file to be used as a parent directory.

interface.name: files_poly_member
interface.summary: Make the specified type a polyinstantiation member directory.

param.name: file_type
param.summary: Type of the file to be used as a member directory.

interface.name: files_poly_member_tmp
interface.summary: Make the domain use the specified type of polyinstantiated directory.

param.name: file_type
param.summary: Type of the file to be used as a member directory.

interface.name: files_tmp_file
interface.summary: Make the specified type a file used for temporary files.

desc.p: Make the specified type usable for temporary files. This will also make the type usable for files, making calls to files_type() redundant. Failure to use this interface for a temporary file may result in problems with purging temporary files.
Related interfaces:
Example usage with a domain that can create and write its temporary file in the system temporary file directories (/tmp or /var/tmp):

param.name: file_type
param.summary: Type of the file to be used as a temporary file.

interface.name: files_tmpfs_file
interface.summary: Transform the type into a file, for use on a virtual memory filesystem (tmpfs).

interface.name: files_read_etc_files
interface.summary: Read generic files in /etc.

desc.p: Allow the specified domain to read generic files in /etc. These files are typically general system configuration files that do not have more specific SELinux types. Some examples of these files are:
This interface does not include access to /etc/shadow.

Generally, it is safe for many domains to have this access. However, since this interface provides access to the /etc/passwd file, caution must be exercised, as user account names can be leaked through this access.
Related interfaces:

interface.name: files_map_etc_files
interface.summary: Map generic files in /etc.

desc.p: Allow the specified domain to map generic files in /etc.

A common use for this is to register a JVM as an interpreter for Java byte code. Registered binaries can be directly executed on a command line without specifying the interpreter.

interface.name: fs_cifs_domtrans
interface.summary: Execute a file on a CIFS or SMB filesystem in the specified domain.

desc.p: Execute a file on a CIFS or SMB filesystem in the specified domain. This allows the specified domain to execute any file on these filesystems in the specified domain. This is not suggested.
No interprocess communication (signals, pipes, etc.) is provided by this interface since the domains are not owned by this module.
This interface was added to handle home directories on CIFS/SMB filesystems, in particular used by the ssh-agent policy.

param.name: target_domain
param.summary: The type of the new process.

interface.name: fs_nfs_domtrans
interface.summary: Execute a file on a NFS filesystem in the specified domain.

desc.p: Execute a file on a NFS filesystem in the specified domain. This allows the specified domain to execute any file on a NFS filesystem in the specified domain. This is not suggested.
No interprocess communication (signals, pipes, etc.) is provided by this interface since the domains are not owned by this module.
This interface was added to handle home directories on NFS filesystems, in particular used by the ssh-agent policy.

param.name: target_domain
param.summary: The type of the new process.

module.name: kernel
module.summary: Policy for kernel threads, proc filesystem, and unlabeled processes and objects.

interface.name: kernel_dyntrans_to
interface.summary: Allows the kernel to start userland processes by dynamic transitions to the specified domain.

param.name: domain
param.summary: The process type entered by the kernel.

interface.name: kernel_domtrans_to
interface.summary: Allows to start userland processes by transitioning to the specified domain.

param.name: domain
param.summary: The process type entered by kernel.

param.name: entrypoint
param.summary: The executable type for the entrypoint.

interface.name: kernel_ranged_domtrans_to
interface.summary: Allows to start userland processes by transitioning to the specified domain, with a range transition.

param.name: domain
param.summary: The process type entered by kernel.

param.name: entrypoint
param.summary: The executable type for the entrypoint.

interface.name: kernel_request_load_module
interface.summary: Allows caller to request the kernel to load a module

desc.p: Allow the specified domain to request that the kernel load a kernel module. An example of this is the auto-loading of network drivers when doing an ioctl() on a network interface.
In the specific case of a module loading request on a network interface, the domain will also need the net_admin capability.

interface.name: kernel_dontaudit_request_load_module
interface.summary: Do not audit requests to the kernel to load a module.

desc.p: Allow the specified domain to read (follow) generic symbolic links (symlinks) in the proc filesystem (/proc). This interface does not include access to the targets of these links. An example symlink is /proc/self.

interface.name: kernel_read_system_state
interface.summary: Allows caller to read system state information in /proc.

desc.p: Allow the specified domain to read general system state information from the proc filesystem (/proc).
Generally it should be safe to allow this access. Some example files that can be read based on this interface:
This does not allow access to sysctl entries (/proc/sys/*) nor process state information (/proc/pid).

desc.p: Allow the specified domain to read the networking state information. This includes several pieces of networking information, such as network interface names, netfilter (iptables) statistics, protocol information, routes, and remote procedure call (RPC) information.

interface.name: kernel_read_kernel_sysctls
interface.summary: Read general kernel sysctls.

desc.p: Allow the specified domain to read general kernel sysctl settings. These settings are typically read using the sysctl program. The settings that are included by this interface are prefixed with "kernel.", for example, kernel.sysrq.
This does not include access to the hotplug handler setting (kernel.hotplug) nor the module installer handler setting (kernel.modprobe).
Related interfaces:

interface.name: kernel_sendrecv_unlabeled_association
interface.summary: Send and receive messages from an unlabeled IPSEC association.

desc.p: Send and receive messages from an unlabeled IPSEC association. Network connections that are not protected by IPSEC have use an unlabeled assocation.
The corenetwork interface corenet_non_ipsec_sendrecv() should be used instead of this one.

interface.name: kernel_dontaudit_sendrecv_unlabeled_association
interface.summary: Do not audit attempts to send and receive messages from an unlabeled IPSEC association.

desc.p: Do not audit attempts to send and receive messages from an unlabeled IPSEC association. Network connections that are not protected by IPSEC have use an unlabeled assocation.
The corenetwork interface corenet_dontaudit_non_ipsec_sendrecv() should be used instead of this one.

interface.name: kernel_tcp_recvfrom_unlabeled
interface.summary: Receive TCP packets from an unlabeled connection.

desc.p: Receive TCP packets from an unlabeled connection.
The corenetwork interface corenet_tcp_recv_unlabeled() should be used instead of this one.

interface.name: kernel_dontaudit_tcp_recvfrom_unlabeled
interface.summary: Do not audit attempts to receive TCP packets from an unlabeled connection.

desc.p: Do not audit attempts to receive TCP packets from an unlabeled connection.
The corenetwork interface corenet_dontaudit_tcp_recv_unlabeled() should be used instead of this one.

interface.name: kernel_udp_recvfrom_unlabeled
interface.summary: Receive UDP packets from an unlabeled connection.

desc.p: Receive UDP packets from an unlabeled connection.
The corenetwork interface corenet_udp_recv_unlabeled() should be used instead of this one.

interface.name: kernel_dontaudit_udp_recvfrom_unlabeled
interface.summary: Do not audit attempts to receive UDP packets from an unlabeled connection.

desc.p: Do not audit attempts to receive UDP packets from an unlabeled connection.
The corenetwork interface corenet_dontaudit_udp_recv_unlabeled() should be used instead of this one.

interface.name: kernel_raw_recvfrom_unlabeled
interface.summary: Receive Raw IP packets from an unlabeled connection.

desc.p: Receive Raw IP packets from an unlabeled connection.
The corenetwork interface corenet_raw_recv_unlabeled() should be used instead of this one.

interface.name: kernel_dontaudit_raw_recvfrom_unlabeled
interface.summary: Do not audit attempts to receive Raw IP packets from an unlabeled connection.

desc.p: Do not audit attempts to receive Raw IP packets from an unlabeled connection.
The corenetwork interface corenet_dontaudit_raw_recv_unlabeled() should be used instead of this one.

interface.name: kernel_sendrecv_unlabeled_packets
interface.summary: Send and receive unlabeled packets.

desc.p: Send and receive unlabeled packets. These packets do not match any netfilter SECMARK rules.
The corenetwork interface corenet_sendrecv_unlabeled_packets() should be used instead of this one.

interface.name: kernel_recvfrom_unlabeled_peer
interface.summary: Receive packets from an unlabeled peer.

desc.p: Receive packets from an unlabeled peer, these packets do not have any peer labeling information present.
The corenetwork interface corenet_recvfrom_unlabeled_peer() should be used instead of this one.

interface.name: kernel_dontaudit_recvfrom_unlabeled_peer
interface.summary: Do not audit attempts to receive packets from an unlabeled peer.

desc.p: Do not audit attempts to receive packets from an unlabeled peer, these packets do not have any peer labeling information present.
The corenetwork interface corenet_dontaudit_*_recvfrom_unlabeled() should be used instead of this one.

interface.name: kernel_relabelfrom_unlabeled_database
interface.summary: Relabel from unlabeled database objects.

interface.summary: Unconfined access to kernel module resources.

interface.summary: Read virtual memory overcommit sysctl.

interface.name: kernel_rw_vm_overcommit_sysctl
interface.summary: Read and write virtual memory overcommit sysctl.

interface.name: kernel_ib_access_unlabeled_pkeys
interface.summary: Access unlabeled infiniband pkeys.

desc.p: Disable kernel module loading.

module.name: mcs
module.required: Contains attributes used in MCS policy.

interface.name: mcs_constrained
interface.summary: Constrain by category access control (MCS).

desc.p: Constrain the specified type by category based access control (MCS) This prevents this domain from interacting with subjects and operating on objects that it otherwise would be able to interact with or operate on respectively.

param.name: domain
param.summary: Type to be constrained by MCS.

interface.name: mcs_file_read_all
interface.summary: This domain is allowed to read files and directories regardless of their MCS category set.

interface.name: mcs_file_write_all
interface.summary: This domain is allowed to write files and directories regardless of their MCS category set.

interface.name: mcs_killall
interface.summary: This domain is allowed to sigkill and sigstop all domains regardless of their MCS category set.

interface.name: mcs_ptrace_all
interface.summary: This domain is allowed to ptrace all domains regardless of their MCS category set.

interface.name: mcs_process_set_categories
interface.summary: Make specified domain MCS trusted for setting any category set for the processes it executes.

module.name: mls

desc.p: This module contains interfaces for handling multilevel security. The interfaces allow the specified subjects and objects to be allowed certain privileges in the MLS rules.

module.required: Contains attributes used in MLS policy.

interface.name: mls_file_read_to_clearance
interface.summary: Make specified domain MLS trusted for reading from files up to its clearance.

interface.name: mls_file_read_all_levels
interface.summary: Make specified domain MLS trusted for reading from files at all levels.

interface.name: mls_file_write_to_clearance
interface.summary: Make specified domain MLS trusted for write to files up to its clearance.

interface.name: mls_file_write_all_levels
interface.summary: Make specified domain MLS trusted for writing to files at all levels.

interface.name: mls_file_relabel_to_clearance
interface.summary: Make specified domain MLS trusted for relabelto to files up to its clearance.

interface.name: mls_file_relabel
interface.summary: Make specified domain MLS trusted for relabelto to files at all levels.

interface.name: mls_file_upgrade
interface.summary: Make specified domain MLS trusted for raising the level of files.

interface.name: mls_file_downgrade
interface.summary: Make specified domain MLS trusted for lowering the level of files.

interface.name: mls_file_write_within_range
interface.summary: Make specified domain trusted to be written to within its MLS range. The subject's MLS range must be a proper subset of the object's MLS range.

interface.name: mls_socket_read_all_levels
interface.summary: Make specified domain MLS trusted for reading from sockets at any level.

interface.name: mls_socket_read_to_clearance
interface.summary: Make specified domain MLS trusted for reading from sockets at any level that is dominated by the process clearance.

interface.name: mls_socket_write_to_clearance
interface.summary: Make specified domain MLS trusted for writing to sockets up to its clearance.

interface.name: mls_socket_write_all_levels
interface.summary: Make specified domain MLS trusted for writing to sockets at any level.

interface.name: mls_net_receive_all_levels
interface.summary: Make specified domain MLS trusted for receiving network data from network interfaces or hosts at any level.

interface.name: mls_net_write_within_range
interface.summary: Make specified domain trusted to write to network objects within its MLS range. The subject's MLS range must be a proper subset of the object's MLS range.

interface.name: mls_net_inbound_all_levels
interface.summary: Make specified domain trusted to write inbound packets regardless of the network's or node's MLS range.

interface.name: mls_net_outbound_all_levels
interface.summary: Make specified domain trusted to write outbound packets regardless of the network's or node's MLS range.

interface.name: mls_sysvipc_read_to_clearance
interface.summary: Make specified domain MLS trusted for reading from System V IPC objects up to its clearance.

interface.name: mls_sysvipc_read_all_levels
interface.summary: Make specified domain MLS trusted for reading from System V IPC objects at any level.

interface.name: mls_sysvipc_write_to_clearance
interface.summary: Make specified domain MLS trusted for writing to System V IPC objects up to its clearance.

interface.name: mls_sysvipc_write_all_levels
interface.summary: Make specified domain MLS trusted for writing to System V IPC objects at any level.

interface.name: mls_key_write_to_clearance
interface.summary: Make specified domain MLS trusted for writing to keys up to its clearance.

interface.name: mls_key_write_all_levels
interface.summary: Make specified domain MLS trusted for writing to keys at all levels.

interface.name: mls_rangetrans_source
interface.summary: Allow the specified domain to do a MLS range transition that changes the current level.

interface.name: mls_rangetrans_target
interface.summary: Make specified domain a target domain for MLS range transitions that change the current level.

interface.name: mls_process_read_to_clearance
interface.summary: Make specified domain MLS trusted for reading from processes up to its clearance.

interface.name: mls_process_read_all_levels
interface.summary: Make specified domain MLS trusted for reading from processes at all levels.

interface.name: mls_process_write_to_clearance
interface.summary: Make specified domain MLS trusted for writing to processes up to its clearance.

interface.name: mls_process_write_all_levels
interface.summary: Make specified domain MLS trusted for writing to processes at all levels.

interface.name: mls_process_set_level
interface.summary: Make specified domain MLS trusted for setting the level of processes it executes.

interface.name: mls_xwin_read_to_clearance
interface.summary: Make specified domain MLS trusted for reading from X objects up to its clearance.

interface.name: mls_xwin_read_all_levels
interface.summary: Make specified domain MLS trusted for reading from X objects at any level.

interface.name: mls_xwin_write_to_clearance
interface.summary: Make specified domain MLS trusted for write to X objects up to its clearance.

interface.name: mls_xwin_write_all_levels
interface.summary: Make specified domain MLS trusted for writing to X objects at any level.

interface.name: mls_colormap_read_all_levels
interface.summary: Make specified domain MLS trusted for reading from X colormaps at any level.

interface.name: mls_colormap_write_all_levels
interface.summary: Make specified domain MLS trusted for writing to X colormaps at any level.

interface.name: mls_trusted_object
interface.summary: Make specified object MLS trusted.

desc.p: Make specified object MLS trusted. This allows all levels to read and write the object.
This currently only applies to filesystem objects, for example, files and directories.

interface.name: mls_trusted_socket
interface.summary: Make specified socket MLS trusted.

desc.p: Make specified socket MLS trusted. For sockets marked as such, this allows all levels to: * sendto to unix_dgram_sockets * connectto to unix_stream_sockets respectively.

interface.name: mls_fd_use_all_levels
interface.summary: Make the specified domain trusted to inherit and use file descriptors from all levels.

interface.name: mls_fd_share_all_levels
interface.summary: Make the file descriptors from the specifed domain inheritable by all levels.

interface.name: mls_context_translate_all_levels
interface.summary: Make specified domain MLS trusted for translating contexts at all levels. (Deprecated)

interface.name: mls_db_read_all_levels
interface.summary: Make specified domain MLS trusted for reading from databases at any level.

interface.name: mls_db_write_all_levels
interface.summary: Make specified domain MLS trusted for writing to databases at any level.

interface.name: mls_db_upgrade
interface.summary: Make specified domain MLS trusted for raising the level of databases.

interface.name: mls_db_downgrade
interface.summary: Make specified domain MLS trusted for lowering the level of databases.

interface.name: mls_dbus_send_all_levels
interface.summary: Make specified domain MLS trusted for sending dbus messages to all levels.

interface.name: mls_dbus_recv_all_levels
interface.summary: Make specified domain MLS trusted for receiving dbus messages from all levels.

module.name: selinux
module.summary: Policy for kernel security interface, in particular, selinuxfs.
module.required: Contains the policy for the kernel SELinux security interface.

interface.name: selinux_labeled_boolean
interface.summary: Make the specified type used for labeling SELinux Booleans. This interface is only usable in the base module.

desc.p: Make the specified type used for labeling SELinux Booleans.
This makes use of genfscon statements, which are only available in the base module. Thus any module which calls this interface must be included in the base module.

param.name: type
param.summary: Type used for labeling a Boolean.

interface.name: selinux_get_fs_mount
interface.summary: Get the mountpoint of the selinuxfs filesystem.

interface.name: selinux_dontaudit_get_fs_mount
interface.summary: Do not audit attempts to get the mountpoint of the selinuxfs filesystem.

interface.name: selinux_mount_fs
interface.summary: Mount the selinuxfs filesystem.

interface.name: selinux_remount_fs
interface.summary: Remount the selinuxfs filesystem. This allows some mount options to be changed.

interface.name: selinux_unmount_fs
interface.summary: Unmount the selinuxfs filesystem.

interface.name: selinux_getattr_fs
interface.summary: Get the attributes of the selinuxfs filesystem

interface.name: selinux_dontaudit_getattr_fs
interface.summary: Do not audit attempts to get the attributes of the selinuxfs filesystem

interface.name: selinux_dontaudit_getattr_dir
interface.summary: Do not audit attempts to get the attributes of the selinuxfs directory.

interface.name: selinux_search_fs
interface.summary: Search selinuxfs.

interface.name: selinux_dontaudit_search_fs
interface.summary: Do not audit attempts to search selinuxfs.

interface.name: selinux_dontaudit_read_fs
interface.summary: Do not audit attempts to read generic selinuxfs entries

interface.name: selinux_get_enforce_mode
interface.summary: Allows the caller to get the mode of policy enforcement (enforcing or permissive mode).

interface.name: selinux_set_enforce_mode
interface.summary: Allow caller to set the mode of policy enforcement (enforcing or permissive mode).

desc.p: Allow caller to set the mode of policy enforcement (enforcing or permissive mode).
Since this is a security event, this action is always audited.

interface.name: selinux_load_policy
interface.summary: Allow caller to load the policy into the kernel.

interface.name: selinux_read_policy
interface.summary: Allow caller to read the policy from the kernel.

interface.name: selinux_set_generic_booleans
interface.summary: Allow caller to set the state of generic Booleans to enable or disable conditional portions of the policy.

desc.p: Allow caller to set the state of generic Booleans to enable or disable conditional portions of the policy.
Since this is a security event, this action is always audited.

interface.name: selinux_set_all_booleans
interface.summary: Allow caller to set the state of all Booleans to enable or disable conditional portions of the policy.

desc.p: Allow caller to set the state of all Booleans to enable or disable conditional portions of the policy.
Since this is a security event, this action is always audited.

interface.name: selinux_set_parameters
interface.summary: Allow caller to set SELinux access vector cache parameters.

desc.p: Allow caller to set SELinux access vector cache parameters. The allows the domain to set performance related parameters of the AVC, such as cache threshold.
Since this is a security event, this action is always audited.

interface.name: selinux_validate_context
interface.summary: Allows caller to validate security contexts.

interface.name: selinux_dontaudit_validate_context
interface.summary: Do not audit attempts to validate security contexts.

interface.name: selinux_compute_access_vector
interface.summary: Allows caller to compute an access vector.

interface.name: selinux_compute_create_context
interface.summary: Calculate the default type for object creation.

interface.name: selinux_compute_member
interface.summary: Allows caller to compute polyinstatntiated directory members.

interface.name: selinux_compute_relabel_context
interface.summary: Calculate the context for relabeling objects.

desc.p: Calculate the context for relabeling objects. This is determined by using the type_change rules in the policy, and is generally used for determining the context for relabeling a terminal when a user logs in.

interface.name: selinux_compute_user_contexts
interface.summary: Allows caller to compute possible contexts for a user.

interface.name: selinux_map_security_files
interface.summary: Allows caller to map secuirty_t files.

interface.name: selinux_unconfined
interface.summary: Unconfined access to the SELinux kernel security server.

desc.p: Boolean to determine whether the system permits loading policy, setting enforcing mode, and changing boolean values. Set this to true and you have to reboot to set it back.

module.name: storage
module.summary: Policy controlling access to storage devices

interface.name: storage_getattr_fixed_disk_dev
interface.summary: Allow the caller to get the attributes of fixed disk device nodes.

interface.name: storage_dontaudit_getattr_fixed_disk_dev
interface.summary: Do not audit attempts made by the caller to get the attributes of fixed disk device nodes.

interface.name: storage_setattr_fixed_disk_dev
interface.summary: Allow the caller to set the attributes of fixed disk device nodes.

interface.name: storage_dontaudit_setattr_fixed_disk_dev
interface.summary: Do not audit attempts made by the caller to set the attributes of fixed disk device nodes.

interface.name: storage_raw_read_fixed_disk
interface.summary: Allow the caller to directly read from a fixed disk. This is extremely dangerous as it can bypass the SELinux protections for filesystem objects, and should only be used by trusted domains.

interface.name: storage_raw_read_fixed_disk_cond
interface.summary: Allow the caller to directly read from a fixed disk if a tunable is set. This is extremely dangerous as it can bypass the SELinux protections for filesystem objects, and should only be used by trusted domains.

interface.name: storage_dontaudit_read_fixed_disk
interface.summary: Do not audit attempts made by the caller to read fixed disk device nodes.

interface.name: storage_raw_write_fixed_disk
interface.summary: Allow the caller to directly write to a fixed disk. This is extremely dangerous as it can bypass the SELinux protections for filesystem objects, and should only be used by trusted domains.

interface.name: storage_dontaudit_write_fixed_disk
interface.summary: Do not audit attempts made by the caller to write fixed disk device nodes.

interface.name: storage_raw_rw_fixed_disk
interface.summary: Allow the caller to directly read and write to a fixed disk. This is extremely dangerous as it can bypass the SELinux protections for filesystem objects, and should only be used by trusted domains.

interface.name: storage_create_fixed_disk_dev
interface.summary: Allow the caller to create fixed disk device nodes.

interface.name: storage_delete_fixed_disk_dev
interface.summary: Allow the caller to delete fixed disk device nodes.

interface.name: storage_manage_fixed_disk
interface.summary: Create, read, write, and delete fixed disk device nodes.

interface.name: storage_dev_filetrans_fixed_disk
interface.summary: Create block devices in /dev with the fixed disk type via an automatic type transition.

param.name: filename
param.summary: Optional filename of the block device to be created

interface.name: storage_tmpfs_filetrans_fixed_disk
interface.summary: Create block devices in on a tmpfs filesystem with the fixed disk type via an automatic type transition.

interface.name: storage_relabel_fixed_disk
interface.summary: Relabel fixed disk device nodes.

interface.name: storage_swapon_fixed_disk
interface.summary: Enable a fixed disk device as swap space

interface.name: storage_watch_fixed_disk
interface.summary: Watch fixed disk device nodes.

interface.name: storage_getattr_fuse_dev
interface.summary: Allow the caller to get the attributes of device nodes of fuse devices.

interface.name: storage_rw_fuse
interface.summary: read or write fuse device interfaces.

interface.name: storage_dontaudit_rw_fuse
interface.summary: Do not audit attempts to read or write fuse device interfaces.

interface.name: storage_getattr_scsi_generic_dev
interface.summary: Allow the caller to get the attributes of the generic SCSI interface device nodes.

interface.name: storage_setattr_scsi_generic_dev
interface.summary: Allow the caller to set the attributes of the generic SCSI interface device nodes.

interface.name: storage_read_scsi_generic
interface.summary: Allow the caller to directly read, in a generic fashion, from any SCSI device. This is extremely dangerous as it can bypass the SELinux protections for filesystem objects, and should only be used by trusted domains.

interface.name: storage_write_scsi_generic
interface.summary: Allow the caller to directly write, in a generic fashion, from any SCSI device. This is extremely dangerous as it can bypass the SELinux protections for filesystem objects, and should only be used by trusted domains.

interface.name: storage_setattr_scsi_generic_dev_dev
interface.summary: Set attributes of the device nodes for the SCSI generic inerface.

interface.name: storage_dontaudit_rw_scsi_generic
interface.summary: Do not audit attempts to read or write SCSI generic device interfaces.

interface.name: storage_getattr_removable_dev
interface.summary: Allow the caller to get the attributes of removable devices device nodes.

interface.name: storage_dontaudit_getattr_removable_dev
interface.summary: Do not audit attempts made by the caller to get the attributes of removable devices device nodes.

interface.name: storage_dontaudit_read_removable_device
interface.summary: Do not audit attempts made by the caller to read removable devices device nodes.

interface.name: storage_dontaudit_write_removable_device
interface.summary: Do not audit attempts made by the caller to write removable devices device nodes.

interface.name: storage_setattr_removable_dev
interface.summary: Allow the caller to set the attributes of removable devices device nodes.

interface.name: storage_dontaudit_setattr_removable_dev
interface.summary: Do not audit attempts made by the caller to set the attributes of removable devices device nodes.

interface.name: storage_raw_read_removable_device
interface.summary: Allow the caller to directly read from a removable device. This is extremely dangerous as it can bypass the SELinux protections for filesystem objects, and should only be used by trusted domains.

interface.name: storage_dontaudit_raw_read_removable_device
interface.summary: Do not audit attempts to directly read removable devices.

interface.name: storage_raw_write_removable_device
interface.summary: Allow the caller to directly write to a removable device. This is extremely dangerous as it can bypass the SELinux protections for filesystem objects, and should only be used by trusted domains.

interface.name: storage_dontaudit_raw_write_removable_device
interface.summary: Do not audit attempts to directly write removable devices.

interface.name: storage_read_tape
interface.summary: Allow the caller to directly read a tape device.

interface.name: storage_write_tape
interface.summary: Allow the caller to directly write a tape device.

interface.name: storage_getattr_tape_dev
interface.summary: Allow the caller to get the attributes of device nodes of tape devices.

interface.name: storage_setattr_tape_dev
interface.summary: Allow the caller to set the attributes of device nodes of tape devices.

interface.name: storage_unconfined
interface.summary: Unconfined access to storage devices.

module.name: terminal
module.required: Depended on by other required modules.

interface.name: term_pty
interface.summary: Transform specified type into a pty type.

param.name: pty_type
param.summary: An object type that will applied to a pty.

interface.name: term_user_pty
interface.summary: Transform specified type into an user pty type. This allows it to be relabeled via type change by login programs such as ssh.

param.name: userdomain
param.summary: The type of the user domain associated with this pty.

param.name: object_type
param.summary: An object type that will applied to a pty.

interface.name: term_login_pty
interface.summary: Transform specified type into a pty type used by login programs, such as sshd.

param.name: pty_type
param.summary: An object type that will applied to a pty.

interface.name: term_tty
interface.summary: Transform specified type into a tty type.

param.name: tty_type
param.summary: An object type that will applied to a tty.

interface.name: term_user_tty
interface.summary: Transform specified type into a user tty type.

param.name: domain
param.summary: User domain that is related to this tty.

param.name: tty_type
param.summary: An object type that will applied to a tty.

interface.name: term_mount_devpts
interface.summary: mount a devpts_t filesystem

param.name: domain
param.summary: The type of the process to mount it

interface.name: term_create_devpts_dirs
interface.summary: Create directory /dev/pts.

param.name: domain
param.summary: The type of the process creating the directory.

interface.name: term_create_pty
interface.summary: Create a pty in the /dev/pts directory.

param.name: domain
param.summary: The type of the process creating the pty.

interface.name: term_write_all_terms
interface.summary: Write the console, all ttys and all ptys.

interface.name: term_use_all_terms
interface.summary: Read and write the console, all ttys and all ptys.

interface.name: term_write_console
interface.summary: Write to the console.

interface.name: term_read_console
interface.summary: Read from the console.

interface.name: term_dontaudit_read_console
interface.summary: Do not audit attempts to read from the console.

interface.name: term_use_console
interface.summary: Read from and write to the console.

interface.name: term_dontaudit_use_console
interface.summary: Do not audit attemtps to read from or write to the console.

interface.name: term_setattr_console
interface.summary: Set the attributes of the console device node.

interface.name: term_relabel_console
interface.summary: Relabel from and to the console type.

interface.name: term_create_console_dev
interface.summary: Create the console device (/dev/console).

interface.name: term_getattr_pty_fs
interface.summary: Get the attributes of a pty filesystem

interface.name: term_relabel_pty_fs
interface.summary: Relabel from and to pty filesystem.

interface.name: term_getattr_pty_dirs
interface.summary: Get the attributes of the /dev/pts directory.

interface.name: term_dontaudit_getattr_pty_dirs
interface.summary: Do not audit attempts to get the attributes of the /dev/pts directory.

interface.name: term_search_ptys
interface.summary: Search the contents of the /dev/pts directory.

interface.name: term_dontaudit_search_ptys
interface.summary: Do not audit attempts to search the contents of the /dev/pts directory.

interface.name: term_list_ptys
interface.summary: Read the /dev/pts directory to list all ptys.

interface.name: term_dontaudit_list_ptys
interface.summary: Do not audit attempts to read the /dev/pts directory.

interface.name: term_dontaudit_manage_pty_dirs
interface.summary: Do not audit attempts to create, read, write, or delete the /dev/pts directory.

interface.name: term_relabel_pty_dirs
interface.summary: Relabel from and to pty directories.

interface.name: term_getattr_generic_ptys
interface.summary: Get the attributes of generic pty devices.

interface.name: term_dontaudit_getattr_generic_ptys
interface.summary: Do not audit attempts to get the attributes of generic pty devices.

interface.name: term_ioctl_generic_ptys

interface.name: term_setattr_generic_ptys
interface.summary: Allow setting the attributes of generic pty devices.

interface.name: term_dontaudit_setattr_generic_ptys
interface.summary: Dontaudit setting the attributes of generic pty devices.

interface.name: term_use_generic_ptys
interface.summary: Read and write the generic pty type. This is generally only used in the targeted policy.

interface.name: term_dontaudit_use_generic_ptys
interface.summary: Dot not audit attempts to read and write the generic pty type. This is generally only used in the targeted policy.

interface.name: term_create_controlling_term
interface.summary: Create the tty device.

interface.name: term_setattr_controlling_term
interface.summary: Set the attributes of the tty device

interface.name: term_use_controlling_term
interface.summary: Read and write the controlling terminal (/dev/tty).

interface.name: term_create_ptmx
interface.summary: Create the pty multiplexor (/dev/ptmx).

interface.name: term_use_ptmx
interface.summary: Read and write the pty multiplexor (/dev/ptmx).

interface.name: term_dontaudit_use_ptmx
interface.summary: Do not audit attempts to read and write the pty multiplexor (/dev/ptmx).

interface.name: term_getattr_all_ptys
interface.summary: Get the attributes of all pty device nodes.

interface.name: term_dontaudit_getattr_all_ptys
interface.summary: Do not audit attempts to get the attributes of any pty device nodes.

interface.name: term_setattr_all_ptys
interface.summary: Set the attributes of all pty device nodes.

interface.name: term_relabelto_all_ptys
interface.summary: Relabel to all ptys.

interface.name: term_dontaudit_use_all_ptys
interface.summary: Do not audit attempts to read or write any ptys.

interface.name: term_relabel_all_ptys
interface.summary: Relabel from and to all pty device nodes.

interface.summary: Get the attributes of all unallocated tty device nodes.

interface.name: term_setattr_unlink_unallocated_ttys
interface.summary: Setattr and unlink unallocated tty device nodes.

interface.name: term_dontaudit_getattr_unallocated_ttys
interface.summary: Do not audit attempts to get the attributes of all unallocated tty device nodes.

interface.name: term_setattr_unallocated_ttys
interface.summary: Set the attributes of all unallocated tty device nodes.

interface.name: term_dontaudit_setattr_unallocated_ttys
interface.summary: Do not audit attempts to set the attributes of unallocated tty device nodes.

interface.name: term_dontaudit_ioctl_unallocated_ttys
interface.summary: Do not audit attempts to ioctl unallocated tty device nodes.

interface.name: term_relabel_unallocated_ttys

interface.summary: Read and write unallocated ttys.

interface.name: term_dontaudit_use_unallocated_ttys

interface.name: term_getattr_all_ttys
interface.summary: Get the attributes of all tty device nodes.

interface.name: term_dontaudit_getattr_all_ttys
interface.summary: Do not audit attempts to get the attributes of any tty device nodes.

interface.summary: Relabel from and to all tty device nodes.

interface.summary: Write to all ttys.

interface.name: term_use_all_ttys
interface.summary: Read and write all ttys.

interface.name: term_dontaudit_use_all_ttys

interface.summary: Read from and write virtio console.

module.name: ubac
module.required: Contains attributes used in UBAC policy.

interface.name: ubac_constrained
interface.summary: Constrain by user-based access control (UBAC).

desc.p: Constrain the specified type by user-based access control (UBAC). Typically, these are user processes or user files that need to be differentiated by SELinux user. Normally this does not include administrative or privileged programs. For the UBAC rules to be enforced, both the subject (source) type and the object (target) types must be UBAC constrained.

param.name: type
param.summary: Type to be constrained by UBAC.

interface.name: ubac_file_exempt
interface.summary: Exempt user-based access control for files.

interface.name: ubac_process_exempt
interface.summary: Exempt user-based access control for processes.

interface.name: ubac_fd_exempt
interface.summary: Exempt user-based access control for file descriptors.

interface.name: ubac_socket_exempt
interface.summary: Exempt user-based access control for sockets.

interface.name: ubac_sysvipc_exempt
interface.summary: Exempt user-based access control for SysV IPC.

interface.name: ubac_xwin_exempt
interface.summary: Exempt user-based access control for X Windows.

interface.name: ubac_dbus_exempt
interface.summary: Exempt user-based access control for dbus.

interface.name: ubac_key_exempt
interface.summary: Exempt user-based access control for keys.

interface.name: ubac_db_exempt
interface.summary: Exempt user-based access control for databases.
